channel.title: 3mpwr App - Curated Disability News
channel.description: Daily curated news on disability rights, accessibility, and benefits across Canada

item.title: ‘Pure Chaos’: Warnings of an Alberta Health-Care Crisis
item.description: Experts say AHS data obtained by The Tyee further indicate the system faces being overwhelmed.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: More U.S. tariffs would be ‘very damaging,' auto industry tells MPs
item.description: Canada's automotive industry representatives said some vehicle manufacturers are voicing concern about being seen as 'too American' in the tense climate.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Market value of Canadian pro women's sports has doubled since 2023, new study finds
item.description: A new study has attached a dollar figure to the explosion of professional women’s sports in Canada, estimating the market value could grow to more than half a billion dollars by 2030.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: ‘Historic' food bank use spurs cost of living concerns from Conservatives
item.description: A new Food Banks Canada report says monthly visits to food banks came close to 2.2 million in March 2025, nearly double the rate in 2019.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Canadians to have another exclusive window to buy World Cup tickets for Toronto, Vancouver matches
item.description: FIFA began the process of selling another one million tickets for next year's World Cup on Monday, with the opening of a new ticket draw marking the start of the tournament's second phase of sales.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: ‘Presence of insects' prompts recall of Canadian soup mix
item.description: The recall notice pertains to the Mitchell's Soup Co. brand Curried Chickpea Stew Mix. The agency said Mitchell’s was recalling the 374 g packet of the product.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Rally for defending public education got a bigger crowd than the one for Alberta separation
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Grizzly killed through Alberta’s new hunting program, province says
item.description: The Alberta government says one grizzly bear has been killed by a member of the Wildlife Management Responder Network, marking the first bear "lethally removed" since that program was implemented last summer.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Ford government to raise donation limits, scrap fixed-term elections
item.description: The sweeping changes to how elections will work in the province were announced through a news release by the provincial government on Monday afternoon.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Alberta government expected to legislate teachers back to work
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Parliamentary committee urges Liberals to fix Indigenous procurement system
item.description: Cross-partisan committee of MPs recommends that Ottawa move “immediately” with First Nations, Métis and Inuit to develop new Indigenous business verification rules.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: No COVID Shot Appointments Available? Check Again Later
item.description: Vaccinations are up this year over last year, but there are enough doses to go around, BC’s health ministry says.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Ford defends Ontario's anti-tariff ad that angered Trump, says he achieved his goal
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Former Manitoba premier, cabinet minister pay ethics fines after probe
item.description: Legislature Speaker Tom Lindsey says former premier Heather Stefanson submitted the payment last week and one of her former cabinet ministers, Jeff Wharton, has also paid his fine.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Manitoba hiring landfill search workers, probe could begin in December: premier
item.description: Manitoba Premier Wab Kinew says the search of a Winnipeg landfill for the remains of a woman killed by Jeremy Skibicki could begin in December.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Some Canadian communities make it mandatory for homeowners to replace lead pipes. Do such bylaws work?
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: B.C. will go ahead with anti-tariff ads despite Trump blow-up over Ontario
item.description: Premier David Eby announced last week that B.C. will roll out digital ads in the U.S. next month 'to explain who wins and who loses' from additional tariffs on softwood lumber.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Shaping Saskatchewan: Laurie Bouvier
item.description: Laurie Bouvier is the executive director of AFCS. Bouvier is originally from Treaty One Territory and moved to Saskatchewan in 2003.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Best of Vancouver award winners 2025: Wellness
item.description: Your Best of Vancouver winners in the Wellness category.

item.title: ‘Between Breaths’ Comes to the Firehall
item.description: The critically acclaimed play about Newfoundland’s ‘Whale Man’ sails into Vancouver.

item.title: Better communication, engaging youth among top issues for Nunavummiut headed to the polls
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: A timeline of Justin Trudeau and Katy Perry’s relationship
item.description: Former prime minister Justin Trudeau and pop star Katy Perry have been linked since this summer when they were spotted out together in Montreal. With a recent outing together in Paris, the two appear to have made their relationship official.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: It's back! Saskatchewan to host Grey Cup in 2027
item.description: “In Saskatchewan, we do Grey Cups right, ” Roughriders president Craig Reynolds.
